ï»¿OFFICIAL DOCUMENTS The World Bank 1818 H Street N.W. (202) 473-1000 INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT Washington, D.C. 20433 Cable Address: INTBAFRAD INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION U.S.A. Cable Address: INDEVAS Dated NOAWX?r Mr. James Droop Senior Policy Adviser Department for International Development 22 Whitehall, London SWIA 2EG United Kingdom Trust Fund Administration Arrangement between the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, acting through the Department for International Development (DFID), and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association concerning the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund (TF No. 071682) Purchase Order 40075177 Dear Mr. Droop: 1. We are pleased to acknowledge on behalf of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development Association ("IDA") (collectively, the "Bank") that the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, acting through the Department for International Development (DFID) (the "Donor"), that the Donor shall make available as a grant the sum of GBP 3,000,000 (three million pounds sterling) for the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund.. Other donors are also expected to contribute to the Trust Fund on the terms and conditions specified in the Annexes to this Arrangement. 2. The Contribution shall be used to finance the activities and the categories of expenditure set forth in the "Description of Activities, Expenditures and Governance Arrangements under the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund" attached hereto as Annex 1, and shall be administered by the Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Arrangement including the "Standard Provisions Applicable to the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund" (the "Standard Provisions") attached hereto as Annex 2. 3. The Donor will deposit the Contribution into such bank account designated by the Bank in installments in accordance with the following schedule and following submission of payment requests by the Bank:
ï»¿-2- (a) promptly following countersignature of this Arrangement by the Donor and submission of a payment request by the Bank, GBP Â£2,000,000 (Two million pounds sterling). (b) on 1 October 2014, GBP Â£1,000,000 (One million pounds sterling). 4. When making each deposit, the Donor will instruct its bank to include in its payment details information (remittance advice) field of its SWIFT payment message, information indicating: the amount paid, that the payment is made by the Donor for TF No. 071682 (the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Instruction"). In addition, the Donor will provide a copy of the Donor's Deposit Instruction to the Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to tfremitadvice@worldbank.org or by fax sent to (202) 614- 1315. 5. The Bank will convert the Contribution funds into the holding currency of the Trust Fund, namely United States Dollars, promptly upon receipt of the Contribution funds and the Deposit Instruction containing the information specified in paragraph 4 at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Where the Contribution proves to be insufficient to complete the activities as a result of an exchange rate fluctuation, neither the Bank nor the Donor will bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 6. Except as provided for in paragraph 4 above, any notice, _ request or other communication to be given or made under this Arrangement will be in writing and delivered by mail, facsimile or e-mail to the respective party's address specified below or at such other address as such party notifies in writing to the other party from time to time: For the Bank Mr. Andreas Seiter Sr. Health Specialist Health, Nutrition and Population Human Development Network The World Bank 1818 H Street, NW Washington, DC 20433 U.S.A. Tel: (202) 473-3629 Fax: (202) 522-3234 Email: aseiter@worldbank.org For the Donor:
ï»¿-3- Mary Hockney; Programme Manager, Health Services Team, Human Development Department; DFID, 22 Whitehall, London, SWIA 2EG Tel: +44 (0) 207 023 0341 Email: m-hocknevWdfid.gov.uk 7. All annexes hereto constitute an integral part of this Arrangement. This Arrangement may be modified only in writing between the Bank and the Donor; provided, however, that such annexes may be modified only with the acceptance of all donors contributing to the Trust Fund. 8. Please confirm your acceptance with the foregoing, on behalf of the Donor, by signing, dating, and returning to us the enclosed copy of this Arrangement. Upon receipt by the Bank of the copy of this Arrangement countersigned by you, this Arrangement will become effective as of the date of the countersignature. Sincerely, INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION Timothy Grant Evans Director, Health, Nutrition and Population AGREED: UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND Acting through Department for International Development (DFID) By: Date:/ -3 James Droop
ï»¿-4- ANNEX 1 Description of Activities, Expenditures and Governance Arrangements under the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Bank and entities (collectively, the "Donors") that provide contributions (the aggregate of all contributions from the Donors, the "Contributions") to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. A. DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIES The objective of this Trust Fund is to promote the harmonization of medicines registration and other areas of medicines regulation as a means to improve access to essential and quality medicines by strengthening governance and regulatory systems of the pharmaceutical sector with a focus on the Africa region. The activities to be supported by this Trust Fund will include: 1. Bank-executed activities: (a) establish financial and project management structures for the implementation of this Trust Fund in consultation with partners; and (b) carry out assessment and technical assistance using the tools and knowledge generated through the activities in the African region. 2. Recipient-executed activities: (a) establish a framework at the regional level to implement common technical standards and quality management systems for medicine registration and other areas of medicines regulation; (b) line up national and regional support for implementation and assist regional economic communities in developing their detailed project plans; and (c) implement a harmonized regulatory approach and quality management system at the national level in participating countries. 3. World Health Organization (WHO)-executed activities: (a) develop common technical standards, documents, tools and processes for medicines registration and other areas of medicines regulation; and (b) provide technical support for training and capacity building to the medicine regulatory agencies at national and regional levels. B. CATEGORIES OF EXPENDITURE 1. For Bank-executed activities, the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) staff costs (salary, benefits and indirects); (b) media and workshops costs; (c) consultants fees; (d) travel expenses; (e) extended term consultants; (f) contractual services; (g) associated overheads; and (h) temporary support staff costs.
ï»¿-5- 2. For Recipient-executed activities, the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) consultants' services; (b) training and workshops; (c) goods; (d) operating costs; and (e) other expenditures allowable under the Bank's policies and procedures for Recipient-executed activities. 3. For WHO-executed activities, the categories of expenditures applicable to Contribution funds transferred to WHO follow WHO's own applicable policies and procedures. Following disbursement by the Bank of funds from the Trust Fund to WHO, the Bank shall have no further responsibility for WHO's use of the funds and activities carried out therewith. C. GOVERNANCE ARRANGEMENTS The Trust Fund shall be managed by the Health, Nutrition and Population Unit, Human Development Network (HDNHE) with a designated Program Manager responsible for the day-to-day management of the Trust Fund. The Bank will be solely responsible for the decision-making related to the management of the Bank-executed activities and Recipient-executed activities. Final decisions on funding proposals of Recipient-executed activities shall be made by the Health, Nutrition and Population Unit (HNP) Sector Board. The Coordination/Advisory group composed of partners (WHO, New Partnership for Africa's Development and any additional partners that may be selected by the Bank based on their capacity to contribute to the objective of the Trust Fund) will have regular meetings with the Bank to ensure successful coordination and synchronized implementation of the activities in the regions. Annual meetings with donors shall be organized by the Bank to provide progress updates on Bank-executed activities and Recipient-executed activities. These meetings shall also provide an opportunity for WHO to discuss with the Donors about the progress of the WHO-executed activities. The Donors shall be responsible for making decisions relating to WHO-executed activities, including allocation of funds to WHO."
ï»¿-6- ANNEX 2 Standard Provisions Applicable to the Global Medicines Regulatory Harmonization Initiative Trust Fund This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Bank and the Donors that provide Contributions to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. 1. Administration of the Contributions 1.1. The Bank shall be responsible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Agreement and shall not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the IBRD and IDA under their Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are expressly reserved. 1.2. Except for those Contribution funds transferred by the Bank to WHO for WHO- executed activities, which shall be administered in accordance with WHO's policies and procedures, the rest of the Contribution shall be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from time to time, including its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corruption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council, taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donor acknowledges that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financing and asset control laws, regulations, rules and executive orders of an individual member country that may apply to the Donor, nor shall it be deemed a waiver, express or implied, of any of the privileges and immunities of the Bank. 2. Commingling, Exchange and Investment of the Contributions 2.1. The Contributions shall be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the funds of the Bank. The Contributions may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintained by the Bank. 2.2. The Contributions may be freely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement. 2.3. The Bank shall invest and reinvest the Contributions pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the Bank. The Bank shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the same purposes as the Contributions.
ï»¿-7- 3. Administrative Cost Recovery 3.1. In order to assist in the defrayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bank under this Agreement, the Bank may deduct and retain for its own account an amount equal to two percent (2%) of each Contribution from the Contributions. In addition, costs for trust fund program management up to a maximum of three percent (3%) of the Contribution shall be charged to the Trust Fund on an actual basis. If the contributions increase beyond what was originally expected at the time of counter-signature of the first administration agreement, and the administrative costs increase as a result, the Donors acknowledge that an additional administrative fee may be applied to such new contributions. 3.2. In order to assist in the defrayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by WHO for WHO-executed activities under the Transfer Agreement, WHO may levy a charge for program support costs equivalent to thirteen percent (13%) of expenditures of any transferred amount from this Trust Fund, and retain the funds recovered through this charge for WHO's own account. 4. Grants to Recipients 4.1. For Recipient-executed activities, the Bank shall, as administrator of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into grant agreements (the "Grant Agreements") with eligible recipients (the "Recipients") consistent with the purposes of this Agreement and on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Agreements. Grant Agreements may be entered into up to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Administration Agreements between the Bank and the Donors. Upon request by a Donor, the Bank shall furnish a copy of the Grant Agreements to the Donors. 4.2. The Bank shall be responsible for the supervision of the activities financed under the Grant Agreements. Subject to the consent of the relevant Recipients, representatives of the Donors may be invited by the Bank to participate in Bank supervision missions related to the Trust Fund. 4.3. The Bank shall promptly inform the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreements and of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreements. To the extent practicable, the Bank shall afford the Donors the opportunity to exchange views before effecting any such modification or exercising any such remedy. 5. Transfers to WHO 5.1. The Bank shall enter into a transfer agreement with WHO (the "Transfer Agreement") to set forth the terms and conditions of the arrangement and the transfer of the Trust Fund funds to finance the WHO-executed activities ("WHO Funds"). Following disbursement by the Bank as trustee of the funds from the Trust Fund to
ï»¿-8- WHO, WHO shall be responsible for the use of the funds transferred to it and the activities carried out therewith, and the Bank shall have no further responsibility for WHO's use of the funds and activities carried out therewith. 5.2. The Donors acknowledge and agree that the Bank has no responsibility, under the Administration Agreement or otherwise for: (i) confirming the use of WHO Funds; (ii) implementing, monitoring, supervising,, evaluating, or providing quality assurance for activities financed by WHO Funds; (iii) providing Donors with financial, progress, results or impact reporting for activities financed by WHO Funds; (iv) any misuse or misprocurement with respect to WHO Funds; or (v) pursuing any Donor interests or WHO undertakings with respect to WHO Funds. The Donors acknowledge and agree that any financial statements with respect to the use of WHO Funds are the responsibility of WHO. The Donors further acknowledge and agree that any Donor remedy or pursuit of Donor interests with respect to WHO Funds shall arise directly between each Donor and WHO, without involvement of the Bank. 5.3. The Transfer Agreement will name the Donors as third party beneficiaries with direct rights on the part of the Donors to seek recourse under the Transfer Agreement and will provide the Bank with the rights of novation and assignment to enable the Donors to seek direct recourse against WHO. 6. Procurement 6.1. For Recipient-executed activities, the Grant Agreements shall provide that the Contributions shall be used by the Recipients to finance expenditures for goods and services, as the case may be, in accordance with the Bank's Guidelines on "Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits" and the Bank's Guidelines on the "Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers," as in effect at the date of entry into the respective Grant Agreements. 6.2. For Bank-executed activities, the employment and supervision of any consultants and the procurement of any goods financed by the Contributions shall be the responsibility of the Bank and shall be carried out in accordance with its applicable policies and procedures. 6.3 For WHO-executed activities, the employment and supervision of any consultants and the procurement of any goods financed by the Trust Fund shall be the responsibility of WHO and shall be carried out in accordance with the WHO's policies and procedures. 7. Accounting and Financial Reporting 7.1. The Bank shall maintain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the Contributions deposited in the Trust Fund account and disbursements made therefrom. 7.2. The Bank shall furnish to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with
ï»¿-9- respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Trust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions shall be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 7.3. The Bank shall provide to the Donors, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising: (1) a management assertion together with an attestation from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of.internal control over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (2) a combined financial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit shall be borne by the Bank. 7.4. If a Donor wishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external auditors of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate scope and terms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the Bank shall arrange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the Bank with respect to such audit, shall be paid by the requesting Donor. 7.5. The Transfer Agreement shall provide that WHO shall: (i) maintain separate records and ledger accounts with respect to the funds transferred to WHO; and (ii) provide on an annual basis, copies of all financial statements and auditors' reports in accordance with the WHO's policies and procedures, in United States dollars to the Bank for distribution to the Donors. 7.6. The Bank shall provide the Donors with copies of all financial statements and auditors' reports received by the Bank from the Recipients pursuant to the Grant Agreements. 8. Progress Reporting 8.1. The Bank shall provide the Donors with an annual report on the progress of the Bank-executed activities and Recipient-executed activities it carried out or supervised under the Trust Fund. Within six (6) months of the final disbursement date specified in paragraph 9.2, the Bank shall furnish to the Donors a final report on the Bank-executed activities and Recipient-executed activities it carried out or supervised under the Trust Fund. 8.2 WHO shall provide the Bank with reports on the progress of the WHO-executed activities pursuant to the terms of the Transfer Agreement.
ï»¿-10- 8.3 Any Donor may review or evaluate Bank-executed activities and Recipient- executed activities financed by the Trust Fund. The Donor and the Bank shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and the Bank shall provide all relevant information within the limits of its policies and procedures. All associated costs shall be borne by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation shall not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 8.4. The Transfer Agreement will also provide that, if any Donor wishes to request to review or evaluate the WHO-executed activities, the Donor and WHO shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and WHO shall provide all relevant information within the limits of its policies and procedures. 9. Disbursement: Cancellation: Refund 9.1 It is expected that the Contributions shall be fully disbursed by the Bank by December 31, 2016. The Bank shall only disburse Contributions for the purposes of this Agreement after such date with the written approval of the Donors. 9.2 Any Donor or the Bank may, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel all or part of the Donor's pro rata share, of any remaining balance of the Contributions that is not committed pursuant to any agreements entered into between the Bank and any consultants, WHO and/or other third parties for the purposes of this Agreement prior to the receipt of such notice, including the Grant Agreements and Transfer Agreement. 9.3. Following the final disbursement date specified in paragraph 9.1, the Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Contributions to the Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account on a pro rata basis based on the Donors' paid Contributions. In the event of a cancellation the Bank shall promptly return to the relevant Donor or Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account the Donor's pro rata share of uncommitted Contributions in accordance with paragraph 9.2. 10. Disclosure The Bank shall disclose this Agreement and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World Bank Policy on Access to Information. By entering into this Agreement, Donors consent to disclosure of this Agreement and related information on this Trust Fund. The Donors and the Bank agree to jointly develop a communications strategy including the coordination of press releases or announcements regarding this Trust Fund, and acknowledge that they intend to include information on this Trust Fund in their periodic public reports and may make information public at any time on their respective web pages including public reports, speeches, newsletters, and other public documents in accordance with their respective policies and procedures.
